title: Nice Sans Font
content:
Not sure what typeface this is... can anyone offer any help? I feel like that "S" is unique enough to lead to a solution.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20140725134206im_/http:/typophile.com/files/NauFont_5676.jpg)

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [Screen Shot 2014-06-21 at 2.46.01 AM.png](http://web.archive.org/web/20140725134206/http:/typophile.com/files/Screen%20Shot%202014-06-21%20at%202.46.01%20AM.png) | 83.16 KB |
author: NNG07

comments.content: The closer I can see is a **[Tungsten (Semibold)](http://web.archive.org/web/20140725134206/http:/www.typography.com/testDriver/index.php?productLineID=100035&styleID=600697)** by Hoefler & Frere-Jones [2004], modified to make square the internal curvatures of /U & /S.
